required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3 yr Efficacy & Safety Study of Zoledronic Acid in Post-menopausal Women With Osteoporosis Treated With Zol Acid for 6 Yrs
clinical_study.official_title: A 3-year, Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Extension to CZOL446H2301E1 to Evaluate the Efficacy and Long Term Safety of 6 and 9 Years Zoledronic Acid Treatment of Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis

brief_summary.textblock: This second extension will evaluate the efficacy and long term safety of zoledronic acid in women with post-menopausal osteoporosis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Total Hip Bone Mineral Density BMD at Year 6 (Baseline) and Year 9
primary_outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 - Year 6)/Year 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Total Hip Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Year 7 and 8 Compared to Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 - Year 6)/Year 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Femoral Neck Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Year 7, 8 and 9 Compared to Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 - Year 6)/Year 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Total Hip Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Year 7, 8 and 9 Compared to Year 0
secondary_outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 0 = 100*(Year 9 - Year 0)/Year 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Femoral Neck Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Year 7, 8 and 9 Compared to Year 0
secondary_outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 0 = 100*(Year 9 - Year 0)/Year 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers (Bone Markers) Serum C-terminal Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (CTx) at Year 6 (Extension 2 Baseline), Year 7, Year 8, Year 9
secondary_outcome.description: Bone marker analysis: All patients had blood samples collected for analysis of serum c-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen (CTx). Serum CTX assays measure a fragment of the C-terminal telopeptide of type 1 collagen released during resorption of mature bone

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers (Bone Markers)Serum N-terminal Propeptide of Type I Collagen (P1NP) at Year 6 (Extension 2 Baseline), Year 7, Year 8, Year 9
secondary_outcome.description: Bone marker analysis: All patients had blood samples collected for analysis of serum n-terminal propeptide of type I collagen (P1NP) The P1NP concentration is directly proportional to the amount of new collagen laid down during bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers (Bone Markers) Serum Bone-specific Alkaline Phosphatase (BSAP). at Year 6 (Extension 2 Baseline), Year 7, Year 8, Year 9
secondary_outcome.description: Bone marker analysis: All patients had blood samples collected for analysis of serum bone-specific alkaline phosphatase (BSAP).Bone-specific alkaline phosphatase (BSAP) is a useful marker of active bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With New/Worsening Morphometric Vertebral Fractures at Year 9 Compared to Year 6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 6 (extension 2 baseline), Year 9 (3 years of study duration)
secondary_outcome.description: Morphometric vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. A fracture was defined as an SQ reading that was greater than the baseline SQ reading.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean of Time to First Clinical Fracture
secondary_outcome.description: The mean of time to the first clinical fracture is estimated from the area under the Kaplan-Meier curve.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height at Years 7, 8 and 9 Relative to Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured using a stadiometer in millimeters (mm). A stadiometer is a piece of medical equipment used for measuring height. It is usually constructed out of a ruler and a sliding horizontal headpiece which is adjusted to rest on the top of the head.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who have received the 4th and 6th dose of zoledronic acid in study CZOL446H2301E1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor kidney, eye, liver health
- Use of certain therapies for osteoporosis in study CZOL446H2301E1
- Abnormal calcium levels
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

group.title: Z9 (Zoledronic Acid 9)
group.description: Group Z9 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for up to 9 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and extension studies (CZOL446H2301E1 and CZOL446H2301E2).

group.title: Z6P3 (Zoledronic Acid 6 Placebo 3)
group.description: Group Z6P3 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for 6 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and the first extension study (CZOL446H2301E1) followed by up to 3 years of placebo in the second extension study (CZOL446H2301E2).

participants_list.participants: "Started" indicates Randomized and Intent-to Treat (ITT) population
3 patients randomized but never received study drug
ITT patients with DXA total hip measure at extension 2 baseline and year 9
ITT patients with DXA total hip measure at extension 2 baseline and year 9

baseline.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all patients who were enrolled in the extension study at Visit 12. This included patients who were randomized to Z9 and Z6P3 groups.

group.title: Z9 (Zoledronic Acid 9)
group.description: Group Z9 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for up to 9 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and extension studies (CZOL446H2301E1 and CZOL446H2301E2).

group.title: Z6P3 (Zoledronic Acid 6 Placebo 3)
group.description: Group Z6P3 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for 6 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and the first extension study (CZOL446H2301E1) followed by up to 3 years of placebo in the second extension study (CZOL446H2301E2).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Total Hip Bone Mineral Density BMD at Year 6 (Baseline) and Year 9
outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 – Year 6)/Year 6.
outcome.population: The modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population included all patients in the ITT population who had DXA measurements of the total hip at Visit 11 (Year 6) and Visit 15 (Year 9). This was the primary population for the primary efficacy parameter.

group.title: Z9 (Zoledronic Acid 9)
group.description: Group Z9 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for up to 9 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and extension studies (CZOL446H2301E1 and CZOL446H2301E2).

measure.title: Percentage Change in Total Hip Bone Mineral Density BMD at Year 6 (Baseline) and Year 9
measure.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 – Year 6)/Year 6.
measure.population: The modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population included all patients in the ITT population who had DXA measurements of the total hip at Visit 11 (Year 6) and Visit 15 (Year 9). This was the primary population for the primary efficacy parameter.

outcome.title: Percentage Change of Total Hip Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Year 7 and 8 Compared to Year 6
outcome.description: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). DXA consists of two X-ray beams with different energy levels that are aimed at the patient's bones. When soft tissue absorption is subtracted out, the BMD can be determined from the absorption of each beam by bone. Percentage change from Year 6 = 100*(Year 9 – Year 6)/Year 6.
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all patients who were enrolled in the extension study at Visit 12. This included patients who were randomized to Z9 and Z6P3 groups. n = the number of patients with measurements at Year 6 and follow-up visits as determined by the analysis window.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With New/Worsening Morphometric Vertebral Fractures at Year 9 Compared to Year 6
outcome.description: Morphometric vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. A fracture was defined as an SQ reading that was greater than the baseline SQ reading.
outcome.time_frame: Year 6 (extension 2 baseline), Year 9 (3 years of study duration)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all patients who were enrolled in the extension study at Visit 12. This included patients who were randomized to Z9 and Z6P3 groups. n= the number of patients with the event

If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. outcome.title: Change in Height at Years 7, 8 and 9 Relative to Year 6
outcome.description: Height was measured using a stadiometer in millimeters (mm). A stadiometer is a piece of medical equipment used for measuring height. It is usually constructed out of a ruler and a sliding horizontal headpiece which is adjusted to rest on the top of the head.
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all patients who were enrolled in the extension study at Visit 12. This included patients who were randomized to Z9 and Z6P3 groups. n = the number of patients with evaluable measurements at both Year 6 and the post-Year 6 visit, as determined by the analysis window.

group.title: Z9 (Zoledronic Acid 9)
group.description: Group Z9 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for up to 9 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and extension studies (CZOL446H2301E1 and CZOL446H2301E2).

measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all patients who were enrolled in the extension study at Visit 12. This included patients who were randomized to Z9 and Z6P3 groups. n = the number of patients with evaluable measurements at both Year 6 and the post-Year 6 visit, as determined by the analysis window.

reported_events.desc: The safety population included all patients in the Intent to Treat (ITT) population who received at least 1 dose of study drug during this second extension study. Adverse Events data used the safety population.

group.title: Z9 (Zoledronic Acid 9)
group.description: Group Z9 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for up to 9 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and extension studies (CZOL446H2301E1 and CZOL446H2301E2).

group.title: Z6P3 (Zoledronic Acid 6 Placebo 3)
group.description: Group Z6P3 patients were those who had been treated with zoledronic acid for 6 years in the core (CZOL446H2301) and the first extension study (CZOL446H2301E1) followed by up to 3 years of placebo in the second extension study (CZOL446H2301E2).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study. Other disclosure agreement that restricts the right of the PI to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed. The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of pooled data (i.e.,data from all sites) in clinical trial.
